Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

34.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
34.str2: To minister to, serve. From huperetes; to be a subordinate, i.e. subserve.

34.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
34.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

35.str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

35.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
35.str2: To indicate, intimate, suggest, show, prove. From hupo and deiknuo; to exhibit under the eyes, i.e. to exemplify.

35.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
35.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

35.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
35.str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.

35.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.

35.parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
35.str2: From anti and the middle voice of lambano; to take hold of in turn, i.e. Succor; also to participate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

35.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
35.str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
From a derivative of mneme; to exercise memory, i.e. Recollect; by implication, to punish; also to rehearse.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

35.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

35.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
35.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
(a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

36.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
36.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

36.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
36.str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

36.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
36.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

36.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
36.str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.

37.str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Weeping, lamentation, crying. From klaio; lamentation.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.

37.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
37.str2: To fall upon, press upon, light upon, come over. From epi and pipto; to embrace or seize.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

37.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
37.str2: To kiss affectionately. From kata and phileo; to kiss earnestly.

37.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

38.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
38.str2: To torment, pain; mid. and pass: To be tormented, pained; I suffer acute pain, physical or mental. From odune; to grieve.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

38.parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

38.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
38.str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
No longer, no more. Also ouk eti from ou and eti; not yet, no longer.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

38.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
38.str2: To send forward, accompany, equip for a journey. From pro and pempo; to send forward, i.e. Escort or aid in travel.

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
